metadata.title: CVE-2021-47616 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: RDMA:Fix use-after-free in rxe_queue_cleanup On error handling path inrxe_qp_from_init() qp->sq.queue is freed and then rxe_create_qp() will droplast reference to this object. qp clean up function will try to free thisqueue one time and it causes UAF bug. Fix it by zeroing queue pointer afterfreeing queue in rxe_qp_from_init().

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47616` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1098.105').
